source.95b66a87:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.c9a30290:
Data_Science_data['min_experience'] = Data_Science_data.experience.apply(lambda x: x.split('-')[0])
Data_Science_data['max_experience'] = Data_Science_data.experience.apply(lambda x: x.split('-')[1].split(' ')[0])
Data_Science_data.loc[Data_Science_data.min_experience == '0','fresher_required'] = 1
Data_Science_data.fresher_required.fillna(value=0,inplace=True)
source.8bafa41c:
sns.countplot(x='experience',data=Data_Science_data,order=Data_Science_data.experience.value_counts()[:10].index)
plt.title('Top 10 experience required for jobs')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.show()
source.fbea16db:
Data_Science_data.loc[Data_Science_data.fresher_required == 1,'locations'].apply(pd.Series).stack().value_counts()[:7].plot.pie(autopct='%1.1f%%')
plt.title("Top 7 regions with most placements for fresher");
source.20c9b93a:
Data_Science_data.loc[Data_Science_data.fresher_required == 0,'locations'].apply(pd.Series).stack().value_counts()[:7].plot.pie(figsize=(12,6),autopct='%1.1f%%')
plt.title("Top 7 regions with most placements for experienced");
source.b45f1fda:
Data_Science_data.query('max_experience >= 3 & max_experience <= 9').skills.apply(pd.Series).stack().value_counts()[:10].plot.bar()
plt.title('Skills Required for experience between 3-9')
plt.show()
source.16d72952:
Data_Science_data.query('max_experience >= 10').skills.apply(pd.Series).stack().value_counts()[:10].plot.bar()
plt.title('Skills Required for experience more than 9')
plt.show()
source.2081c268:
Data_Science_data[Data_Science_data['companies'].str.contains('|'.join(list(Data_Science_data.companies.value_counts()[:10].index)))].skills.apply(pd.Series).stack().value_counts()[:10].plot.bar()
plt.title('Skills Required for top 10 companies')
plt.show()
